G5244-d-08-17-02-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN, M34361, WAS SHOVING 78 CAR TRAIN FROM IC 2 MAIN TO IHB #2 MAIN.  THE WC TRAIN WAS OPERATING UNDER YARD RULES, INTERLOCKING AND ABS ON IHB TRACK AND WHILE IN THE PROCESS OF THE SHOVE MOVE, THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING WITH A SIX LB. G5243-d-08-16-02-WC.Narrative: DURING SWITCHING OPERATIONS, YARD JOB Y101-16 HAD PULLED AHEAD FROM THE SOUTH END OF THE NORTH YARDTOWARDS THE FVW YARD VIA THE HIGHLINE.  THE TRAIN HAD TO PASS OVER THE POCKET SWITCH IN ITS ROUTE.THE POCKET SWITCH WAS LINED GREEN FOR THEIR MOVEMENT AND THE ENGINEER CONTINUED OVER THE SWITCH APRROXIMATELY 10 CARS.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN TOLD THE ENGINEER TO KICK AND THE ENGINEER STATED THE KICK.THE CONDUCTOR DID NOT THINK THE ENGINEER HAD HEARD HIM AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO KICK AGAIN.  THE ENGINEER THEN INFORMED THE CONDUCTOR THAT ID DIDN'T SEEM TO WANT TO DO ANYTHIND BETTER AND THEN WAS TOLD TO JUST KEEP COMING AS HE WAS SO THE CONDUCTOR COULD GET 3 MORE CAR LENGTHS.  THE ENGINEER THEN DOUBLE CHECKED ALL HIS GAUGES AND BUTTONS TO MAKE SURE NOTHING WAS WRONG AND WHEN HE LOOKED UP SAW THAT HIS TRAIN WAS APPROXIMATELY 4 CAR LENGTHS ON THE WRONG TRACK.  AT THIS TIME THE CONDUCTOR WAS ALSOTELLING THE ENGINEER TO STOP, WHICH HE HAD ALREADY DONE.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT ENGINEERING PERSONNEL HAD BEEN WORKING ON THE SWITCH THROUGHOUT THE DAY.  THEY WERE REPLACING THESWITCH STAND AND HAD SPIKED THE SWITCH FOR NORMAL MOVEMENT, THUS ALLOWING JOB Y101-16 TO WORK.  WHENTHE CREW ON Y101-16 WENT IN FOR A BREAK, THE ENGINEERING EMPLOYEES HAD FINISHED THEIR WORK AND PUTTHE SWITCH TARGET ON BACKWARDS AND UNSPIKED THE SWITCH.  THE SWITCH WAS NOW LINED AGAINST JOB Y101-16 THOUGH THE TARGET INDICATED OTHERWISE.  WHEN THE CREW CAME BACK OUT TO WORK, THEY ASSUMED THE SWIT

I1202-d-08-29-02-PATH.Narrative: AT 1:05 AM, A WORK VEHICLE REFERRED TO AS THE LOW BOY DERAILED WEST OF GRAPE CROSSOVER ON TRACK SECTION G6.  A WHEEL BROKE OFF CAUSING OVER 100 FEET OF THIRD RAIL DAMAGE.  A GENIE BOOM LIFT ATTACHED TO THE FLAT BED OF THE LOW BOY FOULED THE ADJACENT TRACK SUSPENDING PASSENGER SERVICE FOR APPROXIMATELY 1-1/2 HOURS.  THE CAUSE FOR THE BROKEN WHEEL APPEARS TO BE FAILURE OF ONE OR MORE OF THE BOLTS THAT CONNECT THE WHEEL TO THE AXLE HUB.  THE LOW BOY HAS BEEN USED FOR VARIOUS PATH CONSTRUCTION AND REPAIR PROJECTS AND IS OWNED AND OPERATED BY A CONTRACTOR.  COST TO REPAIR THE EQUIPMENT WAS NOT PATH`S RESPONSIBILITY.  DURING THE INCIDENT ONE EMPLOYEE WAS INJURED WHEN HE FELL OFF THE EQUIPMENT INTOTHE TRACK AREA.  COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE INCIDENTARE ESTIMATED TO BE APPROXIMATELY $12012.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

I1102-d-08-29-02-PATH.Narrative: THE CONTRACTOR HI-RAIL CRANE WAS ROUTED TO MOVE EAST FROM HARRISON YARD TO TRACK 22 IN C YARD.  THEEQUIPMENT WAS ROUTED THROUGH TRACK `S`, AND HAD TO PASS UNDER THE ROTUNDA AT JOURNAL SQUARE STATION.THE PILOT ON THE EQUIPMENT (PATH EMPLOYEE #1328) STATES THAT BEFORE PROCEEDING UNDER THE ROTUNDA HE VISUALLY CHECKED THAT THE BOOM WAS DOWN AND VERIFIED WITH THE OPERATOR (YONKER`S EMPLOYEE) THAT THE BOOM WAS FULLY LOWERED.  AS THE HI-RAIL PROCEEDED EAST, THE FORWARD PORTION OF THE VEHICLE CLEAREDWITH NO PROBLEM.  THE TRAILING EDGE OF THE BOOM CAME IN CONTACT WITH THE CEILING DISLODGING SEVERALPANELS.  THE DAMAGE COSISTED OF SEVERAL DISLODGED PANELS WITH THE WESTERN END OF THE FASCIA DENTEDAPPROXIMATELY 3 INCHES DEEP.  THE DAMAGE EXTENDED FOR 25 FEET.  WHEN INVESTIGATORS ARRIVED AT THE SCENE MOMENTS LATER, THE TRAILING EDGE OF THE BOOM WAS SEVERAL INCHES BELOW THE CEILING.  THE OPERATORSTATED THAT THE VEHICLE`S COMPUTER INDICATED THE BOOM WAS AT ZERO (FULLY LOWERED).  AFTER THE INCIDENT HE ENGAGED THE MANUAL OVERRIDE AND WAS ABLE TO LOWER THE BOOM ANOTHER 2-3 INCHES.  TRACK S1 WASHELD OUT OF SERVICE DUE TO DEBRIS OBSTRUCTING THE ROAD BED.  THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE HI-RAIL CRANE.  INSPECTION OF THE COMPUTER LATER VERIFIED THAT IT WAS NOT CALIBRATED PROPERLY TO THE FULLY LOWERED POSITION.  DAMAGE TO THE ROTUNDA WAS ESTIMATED AT $35,000.None

DURING RERAILING PROCESS ,DERAILED LOCOMOTIVE, DIESEL TANK WAS RUPTURED RESULTING IN DIESEL SPILL.   8/26/02, PER WSOR, THEIRINCIDENT NUMBER IS 0208211.  WSOR ADVISED THAT ADDITIONAL DAMAGE WAS INCURRED TO LOCOMOTIVE DURINGRERAILING PROCESS (RUPTURED TANK).   ROOT CAUSE OF INCIDENT : WSOR DISPATCHER COMMUNICATION FAILURE.AT 0230 HOURS, 8/21, CPR WISCONSIN DISPATCHER TELEPHONED WSOR DISPATCHER TO REPORT WEST-END CROSSOVER SWITCH ON MAIN TRACK TO EAST SCANLON TRACK AT CPR'S MADISON YARD WAS BAD ORDER AND OUT OF SERVICE.  WSOR DISPATCHER ADVISED CPR DISPATCHER HE WOULD RELAY THIS INFORMATION TO THE WSOR MALAM CREW WHEN THEY REPORTED FOR DUTY AT 0400 HOURS, 8/21, AT WSOR'S MADISON YARD FACILITY -- SO THE WSOR CREWWOULD NOT USE THE B/O XO SWITCH. AT 0400 HOURS, 8/21, WSOR MALAM CREW REPORTED FOR DUTY AT WSOR'S MADISON YARD OFFICE.  THEY WERE NOT ADVISED BY WSOR DISPATCHER OF THE BAD ORDER SWITCH AND AT APPROX.0520 HOURS THE WSOR CREW MADE A MOVE OVER THE BAD ORDER SWITCH AND DERAILED TWO CARS.NoneNoneNone

020108-d-08-01-02-NYA.Narrative: THE RS-302 DERAILED ONE BOXCAR AND DAMAGED ANOTHER WHILE SWITCHING WITHIN THE CONFINES OF MASPETH YARD IN MASPETH, N.Y. THE MOVES WERE FOR THE REAR OF THE TRAIN TO SWITCH INDUSTRIES WHILE THE FRONT OFTHE TRAIN CLEARED THE MAIN TRACK.  ONCE CLEAR OF THE MAIN TRACK, THE EAST SECTION WAS TO HOLD ON THE MASPETH LEAD TRACK UNTIL THE WEST END HAD CLEARED THE MASPETH AVENUE GRADE CROSSING.  NYA ENGINE 106 WAS ON THE EAST (FRONT) OF THE TRAIN AND THE NYA ENGINE 105 WAS ON THE WEST (REAR) END OF THE TRAIN.  THE ENGINEER WAS TO CLEAR THE END EAST AND OF THE TRAIN WHILE THE CONDUCTOR (ENGINEER CERTIFIED) AND THE ASSISTANT CONDUCTOR MADE THE MOVE TO CLEAR THE GRADE CROSSING.  THE CREW FAILED TO ESTABLISH PROPER COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE TWO SECTIONS RESULTING IN THE COLLISION/DERAILMENT.  THE CAUSE OF ACCIDENT/INCIDENT WAS HUMAN ERROR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

AFTER TRAIN STOPPED, CONDUCTOR WALKED TO LEAD END AND TOLD ENGINEER TO PULL AHEAD, MADE CUT SET OVER CARS TO SOUTH TRACKS, THEN TIED BACK ON TO CENTER TRACK.  WHEN ENGINEER BEGAN TO PULL, AFTER 8 -9 CAR LENGTHS, HE NOTICED CARS PULLING HARD AND TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  UPON INSPECTION, NINE CARS WERE FOUND TO HAVE DERAILED.  FIRST CAR HAS SPLIT SWITCH FROM CENTER TRACK, SWITCH NOT BEING PROPERLY SECURED, ALLOWING FOR GAPPED SWITCH POINT. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE5TH REAR CAR WAS LEAKING DUE TO TANK BEING PUNCTURED BY THE L2 WHEEL.  BOTH CARS WERE LOADED WITH UNLEADED GASOLINE.  THE TIME OF INCIDENT WAS 1505 HRS.  THE  ALBANY FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS NOTIFIED AT 1512 HRS, AND ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AT 1516 HOURS.  CAR GATX 66348, UN1203, WASTE MOTOR SPIRT GASOLINE, LOST 100 GALLONS, WHICH WAS RELEASED.  THAT WAS THE ONLY LEAK.  INVESTIGATION IS STILL ONGOING.  RE. CAUSE TEC 63 GEOMETRY CAR WILL TEST THE AREA 10/25/2002 AND THE RESULTS WILL BE SIMULATED BY CPR'S TAP&T IN CALGARY, ALBERTA.  IT MAY BE LATE NOVEMBER BEFORE THE RESULTS ARE KNOWN.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
